channel.title: 1 Player Server
channel.description:
Who thinks this would an enjoyable experience? And I ask for you to consider it for a second.
Don't think of it as an MMORPG, think of it as an RPG you can get on Nintendos, PS2's, 360's etc.
Think of it as a RuneScape version of Final Fantasy, Zelda or [url=http://uk.ps2.ign.com/articles/165/165580p1.html]Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance[/url] etc.
Running the Client would also call the Server, so it's just like turning on a console. Have a main menu, with New Game, Load Game or Options before the player rendering is initiated.
Have obelisks or altars which are save points in the game, just like in console games.
Have the Server be one big themed quest storyline, like a game you'd buy from a shop, instead of running around aimlessly doing little quests.
Maybe even an Online mode like Call of Duty or GTA IV, but when you've completed the storyline.
I've always wanted to do this, and with a big enough imagination, this could be very captivating.
I just want to know if you'd ever play it?

item.title: 1 Player Server
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:63, topic:382603”]1. Never did I say MITB was the father of RuneScape cheating. I stated that the original site of these forums(mitb) was intended for RuneScape cheating. For further clarification, refer to my previous post.
2. Emulators use little(1 class) to no code provided by Jagex. You are talking about using most(all) of the client. The client is ~100% Jagex code. Using any of their code(model rendering, cache decompression, etc) is technically a violation of the DMCA and DEPENDING on how popular this “game”(if it can even be called that) becomes, and DEPENDING on how retentive Jagex is with their proprietary code, ONLY THEN could there be any sort of legal repercussions.
3. Any further posts about this matter will be disregarded by myself.

[quote author=I Vain I link=topic=478397.msg3504384#msg3504384 date=1298030823]

…
[/quote]WinterLove uses both the Stream and Cryption classes which are from the dob, thus Jagex’s code.

Also, it was blake’s StreamBuffer which replaced the Stream class, and the Cryption class was rewritten as well.

Yes. I couldn’t remember the name of it exactly, but my point was that emulator’s use little, if any proprietary code, where as what he’s planning, using the client to make his own “game” will use a majority of the proprietary code(model rendering, model format, cache de/compression, cache format, etc.).[/quote]
I DON’T CARE ABOUT LEGAL REPURCUSSIONS! SO PLEASE DISREGARD MY POST AND FOCUS ON THE IDEA.

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: 1 Player Server
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

  1. Never did I say MITB was the father of RuneScape cheating. I stated that the original site of these forums(mitb) was intended for RuneScape cheating. For further clarification, refer to my previous post.
  2. Emulators use little(1 class) to no code provided by Jagex. You are talking about using most(all) of the client. The client is ~100% Jagex code. Using any of their code(model rendering, cache decompression, etc) is technically a violation of the DMCA and DEPENDING on how popular this “game”(if it can even be called that) becomes, and DEPENDING on how retentive Jagex is with their proprietary code, ONLY THEN could there be any sort of legal repercussions.
  3. Any further posts about this matter will be disregarded by myself.

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=478397.msg3504377#msg3504377 date=1298030395]
…
[/quote]WinterLove uses both the Stream and Cryption classes which are from the dob, thus Jagex’s code.

Also, it was blake’s StreamBuffer which replaced the Stream class, and the Cryption class was rewritten as well.[/quote]

Yes. I couldn’t remember the name of it exactly, but my point was that emulator’s use little, if any proprietary code, where as what he’s planning, using the client to make his own “game” will use a majority of the proprietary code(model rendering, model format, cache de/compression, cache format, etc.).

Read full topic

item.title: 1 Player Server
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=478397.msg3504377#msg3504377 date=1298030395]

  1. No emulator uses any of Jagex’s code(with the exception of the stream class, but blakeman8192 fixed that(RSStream)).
  2. No one here distributes the client. They upload it to another site, and have that site distribute it. That is totally legal. But if one were to host the client on their personal computer, and have users download it from their computer, that wouldn’t be legal. Basically, it’s like if you search “child porn” on Google, and a link to http://www.childprawns.net/ or whatever showed up. Google wouldn’t receive any sort of legal issues, because they’re just providing a link to the content, not providing the content itself.
  3. Our goal here isn’t to “rebel against Jagex”. In making a RuneScape Emulator, you’re doing nothing against Jagex. Those who develop/play RuneScape Emulators either currently play RuneScape, or have ceased to play RuneScape. The goal of this site was to allow programmers to create a RuneScape Emulator where they could do whatever they wanted. Things they couldn’t do normally(Note: The original site, mitb, was created for RuneScape cheating. Emulators were created to provide an environment in which people could test their bots, SCAR scripts, etc.). Emulator development was then branched off into it’s own location.
    [/quote]WinterLove uses both the Stream and Cryption classes which are from the dob, thus Jagex’s code.

Also, it was blake’s StreamBuffer which replaced the Stream class, and the Cryption class was rewritten as well.[/quote]
Vain how long are you fucking on here o-o

Read full topic

item.title: 1 Player Server
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

  1. No emulator uses any of Jagex’s code(with the exception of the stream class, but blakeman8192 fixed that(RSStream)).
  2. No one here distributes the client. They upload it to another site, and have that site distribute it. That is totally legal. But if one were to host the client on their personal computer, and have users download it from their computer, that wouldn’t be legal. Basically, it’s like if you search “child porn” on Google, and a link to http://www.childprawns.net/ or whatever showed up. Google wouldn’t receive any sort of legal issues, because they’re just providing a link to the content, not providing the content itself.
  3. Our goal here isn’t to “rebel against Jagex”. In making a RuneScape Emulator, you’re doing nothing against Jagex. Those who develop/play RuneScape Emulators either currently play RuneScape, or have ceased to play RuneScape. The goal of this site was to allow programmers to create a RuneScape Emulator where they could do whatever they wanted. Things they couldn’t do normally(Note: The original site, mitb, was created for RuneScape cheating. Emulators were created to provide an environment in which people could test their bots, SCAR scripts, etc.). Emulator development was then branched off into it’s own location.

item.title: 1 Player Server
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:57, topic:382603”]What would be the point of having it OFFLINE if people need to be ONLINE to receive the updates? Like stated earlier, If we wanted to play a Single Player game, we’d play a Single Player game.

Also, the legality of this would be questionable. Since you would be distributing content that isn’t yours(ie. the client files, the cache, etc) and if it were to gain the popularity of something like Minecraft, Jagex would probably call you out on using their code. Even if you wrote it, line by line, they would still own the intellectual property.[/quote]
Dude were a site that does nothing but steal work and tweak it for profit or fun. Why are you even on this site if you seem to be worried about Jagex getting on your ass? Its the risk we take to rebel.

Read full topic

Also, the legality of this would be questionable. Even if you wrote it, line by line, they would still own the intellectual property.[/quote]
Who said anything about updating? I’d just make a “number 2”, and besides, notice I said about an online mode…?

Plus, we’re all here messing with code that isn’t ours, popular or not, isn’t that the whole reason we are here, to rebel to Jagex.

Anyway, it’s probably too much for me to accomplish on my own. I’ve been offered by someone to team up but they haven’t got back to me.

I’m liking the mixed responses, although some people aren’t reading it word for word.

Read full topic

I think this would be a rather good idea. If you could take the games maps and models and say put them into a 3d engine like that one person did with a fps and then say, take character models from some popular game like castle Vania and rebuild that characters look and use their animations for walking you could have it up in the sense of logging in in about 3 days. Good luck to you on this cause that actuly sounds pretty cool.

item.title: 1 Player Server
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:54, topic:382603”]@Rix_ originally I thought his plan was to not include the server side to the game with the client. So that clients would connect to the server but still experience a single player game. The advantage of this method is player data could be stored remotely to prevent character modification, as well as game updates that do not require you to re-download the game.

What I was suggesting was, if he were to use that method, instead of building a player list and looping through the updating of each player, create an instance of the world for each individual player. That world would implement Runnable and just handle local updating and npcs for the user the world is instanced to.

About the dynamic content of his server. If it is going to be single player it will need a lot more depth. More random actions occurring, as well as a world more interactive, that possibly changes slightly with player decisions. To implement this you would need to have event listeners and a fair few threaded processes running asynchronously so that the game can have a wide array of actions ticking at once.[/quote]
EXACTLY how I’d love for it to be! But I could not put it in to code as beautifully as you described.

But spot on.

Read full topic

item.title: 1 Player Server
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

@Rix_ originally I thought his plan was to not include the server side to the game with the client. So that clients would connect to the server but still experience a single player game. The advantage of this method is player data could be stored remotely to prevent character modification, as well as game updates that do not require you to re-download the game.

What I was suggesting was, if he were to use that method, instead of building a player list and looping through the updating of each player, create an instance of the world for each individual player. That world would implement Runnable and just handle local updating and npcs for the user the world is instanced to.

About the dynamic content of his server. If it is going to be single player it will need a lot more depth. More random actions occurring, as well as a world more interactive, that possibly changes slightly with player decisions. To implement this you would need to have event listeners and a fair few threaded processes running asynchronously so that the game can have a wide array of actions ticking at once.

Read full topic

item.title: 1 Player Server
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Then it wouldn’t be called a server, you’re just running a world of your own. If it was a server, it listens for connections. Well at least that’s the definition of it. Just a suggestion to you, Mendorphins, if you ever write that game, you might want to include two modes: single-player mode and network mode. Just like Minecraft.

I Vain I:

So, you mean you want to create a single entity engine using the RuneScape deob/cache, am I right?

Wrong words but you can actually make a game out of RuneScape’s game engine.

Blah blah blah, why are you all suddenly talking about a game that’s more inclined towards RuneScape now?

Wintercanon:

Seeing as you will have a lot of dynamic content running asynchronously…

You must be Einstein, care to enlighten us? Mendorphins didn’t even post anything related to the source code of the game.

Edit: What the fuck…

Wintercanon:

Only do local player updating and create a new instance of the world for each player. That’s what I’d do.

What are you on about? He’s talking about a single-player game, is he not?

Read full topic

item.description:

Only do local player updating and create a new instance of the world for each player. That’s what I’d do.
[/quote]
What my main goal was, was to have something someone can play whilst offline.

It’s nothing to do with downgrading or upgrading. It’s to do with being different.

The only way I can really put it in to perspective is to make an example.[/quote]Then you would have to include the server classes with the client, if you wanted it to be offline that is.
